intro: Tephrosia kirkii, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. The seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine for their antifungal and antibacterial properties.
